00034   template<typename TObj, int8_t TYPEID, const char* TYPENAME,
00035       const char* SPRINTFSYM, int32_t STRSIZE>
00036   class CacheableKeyType: public CacheableKey
00037   {
00038   protected:
00039     TObj m_value;
00040 
00041     inline CacheableKeyType() :
00042       m_value(gemfire::serializer::zeroObject<TObj>())
00043     {
00044     }
00045 
00046     inline CacheableKeyType(const TObj value) :
00047       m_value(value)
00048     {
00049     }
00050 
00051   public:
00053     inline TObj value() const
00054     {
00055       return m_value;
00056     }
00057 
00058     // Cacheable methods
00059 
00061     virtual void toData(DataOutput& output) const
00062     {
00063       gemfire::serializer::writeObject(output, m_value);
00064     }
00065 
00067     virtual Serializable* fromData(DataInput& input)
00068     {
00069       gemfire::serializer::readObject(input, m_value);
00070       return this;
00071     }
00072 
00079     virtual int32_t classId() const
00080     {
00081       return 0;
00082     }
00083 
00090     virtual int8_t typeId() const
00091     {
00092       return TYPEID;
00093     }
00094 
00096     virtual CacheableStringPtr toString() const
00097     {
00098       char buffer[STRSIZE + 1];
00099       gf_sprintf(buffer, SPRINTFSYM, m_value);
00100       return CacheableString::create(buffer);
00101     }
00102 
00103     // CacheableKey methods
00104 
00106     virtual uint32_t hashcode() const
00107     {
00108       return gemfire::serializer::hashcode(m_value);
00109     }
00110 
00112     virtual bool operator ==(const CacheableKey& other) const
00113     {
00114       if (other.typeId() != TYPEID) {
00115         return false;
00116       }
00117       const CacheableKeyType& otherValue =
00118           static_cast<const CacheableKeyType&> (other);
00119       return gemfire::serializer::equals(m_value, otherValue.m_value);
00120     }
00121 
00123     inline bool operator ==(const TObj other) const
00124     {
00125       return gemfire::serializer::equals(m_value, other);
00126     }
00127 
00132     virtual int32_t logString(char* buffer, int32_t maxLength) const
00133     {
00134       char fmt[64];
00135       gf_sprintf(fmt, "%s( %s )", TYPENAME, SPRINTFSYM);
00136       return gf_snprintf(buffer, maxLength, fmt, m_value);
00137     }
00138 
00147     virtual uint32_t objectSize() const
00148     {
00149       return sizeof(CacheableKeyType);
00150     }
00151   };
00152 
00153   // Forward declaration for SharedArrayPtr
00154   template<typename TObj, int8_t TYPEID> class SharedArrayPtr;
00155 
00157   template<typename TObj>
00158   inline void copyArray(TObj* dest, const TObj* src, int32_t length)
00159   {
00160     memcpy(dest, src, length * sizeof(TObj));
00161   }
00162 
00167   template<typename TObj>
00168   inline void copyArray(SharedPtr<TObj>* dest, const SharedPtr<TObj>* src,
00169       int32_t length)
00170   {
00171     for (int32_t index = 0; index < length; index++) {
00172       dest[index] = src[index];
00173     }
00174   }
00175 
00180   template<typename TObj, int8_t TYPEID>
00181   inline void copyArray(SharedArrayPtr<TObj, TYPEID>* dest,
00182       const SharedArrayPtr<TObj, TYPEID>* src, int32_t length)
00183   {
00184     for (int32_t index = 0; index < length; index++) {
00185       dest[index] = src[index];
00186     }
00187   }

00190   template<typename TObj, int8_t TYPEID>
00191   class CacheableArrayType: public Cacheable
00192   {
00193   protected:
00194 
00195     TObj* m_value;
00196     int32_t m_length;
00197 
00198     inline CacheableArrayType() :
00199       m_value(NULL), m_length(0)
00200     {
00201     }
00202 
00203     inline CacheableArrayType(int32_t length) :
00204       m_length(length)
00205     {
00206       if (length > 0) {
00207         GF_NEW(m_value, TObj[length]);
00208       }
00209     }
00210 
00211     inline CacheableArrayType(TObj* value, int32_t length) :
00212       m_value(value), m_length(length)
00213     {
00214     }
00215 
00216     inline CacheableArrayType(const TObj* value, int32_t length, bool copy) :
00217       m_value(NULL), m_length(length)
00218     {
00219       if (length > 0) {
00220         GF_NEW(m_value, TObj[length]);
00221         copyArray(m_value, value, length);
00222       }
00223     }
00224 
00225     virtual ~CacheableArrayType()
00226     {
00227       GF_SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY(m_value);
00228     }
00229 
00230   private:
00231 
00232     // Private to disable copy constructor and assignment operator.
00233     CacheableArrayType(const CacheableArrayType& other)
00234     {
00235     }
00236 
00237     CacheableArrayType& operator =(const CacheableArrayType& other)
00238     {
00239       return *this;
00240     }
00241 
00242   public:
00243 
00245     inline const TObj* value() const
00246     {
00247       return m_value;
00248     }
00249 
00251     inline int32_t length() const
00252     {
00253       return m_length;
00254     }
00255 
00257     inline TObj operator [](uint32_t index) const
00258     {
00259       if ((int32_t) index >= m_length) {
00260         throw OutOfRangeException(
00261             "CacheableArray::operator[]: Index out of range.");
00262       }
00263       return m_value[index];
00264     }
00265 
00266     // Cacheable methods
00267 
00269     virtual void toData(DataOutput& output) const
00270     {
00271       gemfire::serializer::writeObject(output, m_value, m_length);
00272     }
00273 
00275     virtual Serializable* fromData(DataInput& input)
00276     {
00277       GF_SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY(m_value);
00278       gemfire::serializer::readObject(input, m_value, m_length);
00279       return this;
00280     }
00281 
00288     virtual int32_t classId() const
00289     {
00290       return 0;
00291     }
00292 
00299     virtual int8_t typeId() const
00300     {
00301       return TYPEID;
00302     }
00303 
00312     virtual uint32_t objectSize() const
00313     {
00314       return (sizeof(CacheableArrayType) + gemfire::serializer::objectSize(
00315           m_value, m_length));
00316     }
00317 
00318   };
00319 
00323   template<typename TObj, int8_t TYPEID>
00324   class SharedArrayPtr: public SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> >
00325   {
00326   private:
00327 
00328     typedef CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> TArray;
00329 
00330   public:
00331 
00333     inline SharedArrayPtr() :
00334       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > ()
00335     {
00336     }
00337 
00339     inline SharedArrayPtr(const TArray* ptr) :
00340       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > (ptr)
00341     {
00342     }
00343 
00345     inline SharedArrayPtr(const NullSharedBase* ptr) :
00346       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > (ptr)
00347     {
00348     }
00349 
00351     inline SharedArrayPtr(const SharedArrayPtr& other) :
00352       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > (other)
00353     {
00354     }
00355 
00357     template<typename TOther, int8_t OTHERID>
00358     inline SharedArrayPtr(const SharedArrayPtr<TOther, OTHERID>& other) :
00359       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > (other)
00360     {
00361     }
00362 
00364     template<typename TOther>
00365     inline SharedArrayPtr(const SharedPtr<TOther>& other) :
00366       SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> > (other)
00367     {
00368     }
00369 
00371     inline TObj operator [](uint32_t index) const
00372     {
00373       return SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> >::ptr()-> operator [](
00374           index);
00375     }
00376 
00378     inline Serializable * fromData(DataInput & input)
00379     {
00380       return SharedPtr<CacheableArrayType<TObj, TYPEID> >::ptr()->fromData(input);
00381     }
00382   };

00385   template<typename TBase, int8_t TYPEID>
00386   class CacheableContainerType: public Cacheable, public TBase
00387   {
00388   protected:
00389 
00390     inline CacheableContainerType() :
00391       TBase()
00392     {
00393     }
00394 
00395     inline CacheableContainerType(const int32_t n) :
00396       TBase(n)
00397     {
00398     }
00399 
00400   public:
00401 
00402     // Cacheable methods
00403 
00405     virtual void toData(DataOutput& output) const
00406     {
00407       gemfire::serializer::writeObject(output, *this);
00408     }
00409 
00411     virtual Serializable* fromData(DataInput& input)
00412     {
00413       gemfire::serializer::readObject(input, *this);
00414       return this;
00415     }
00416 
00423     virtual int32_t classId() const
00424     {
00425       return 0;
00426     }
00427 
00434     virtual int8_t typeId() const
00435     {
00436       return TYPEID;
00437     }
00438 
00447     virtual uint32_t objectSize() const
00448     {
00449       return (sizeof(CacheableContainerType) +
00450           gemfire::serializer::objectSize(*this));
00451     }
00452   };

00471 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_KEY_TYPE_DEF_(p, k, sz)                           \
00472   extern const char tName_##k [];                                       \
00473   extern const char tStr_##k [];                                        \
00474   TEMPLATE_EXPORT CacheableKeyType<p, GemfireTypeIds::k,                \
00475       tName_##k, tStr_##k, sz>;                                         \
00476   typedef CacheableKeyType<p, GemfireTypeIds::k,                        \
00477     tName_##k, tStr_##k, sz> _##k;                                      \
00478   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT k;                                              \
00479   typedef SharedPtr<k> k##Ptr;
00480 
00481 // use a class instead of typedef for bug #283
00482 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_KEY_TYPE_(p, k, sz)                               \
00483   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT k: public _##k                                  \
00484   {                                                                     \
00485   protected:                                                            \
00486     inline k() : _##k() { }                                             \
00487     inline k(const p value) : _##k(value) { }                           \
00488   public:                                                               \
00489      \
00490     static Serializable* createDeserializable() {                       \
00491       return new k();                                                   \
00492     }                                                                   \
00493            \
00494     inline static k##Ptr create() {                                     \
00495       return k##Ptr(new k());                                           \
00496     }                                                                   \
00497  \
00498     inline static k##Ptr create(const p value) {                        \
00499       return k##Ptr(new k(value));                                      \
00500     }                                                                   \
00501   };                                                                    \
00502   inline CacheableKeyPtr createKey(const p value) {                     \
00503     return k::create(value);                                            \
00504   }                                                                     \
00505   inline CacheablePtr createValue(const p value) {                      \
00506     return k::create(value);                                            \
00507   }                                                                     \
00508 
00509 
00510 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_ARRAY_TYPE_DEF_(p, c)                             \
00511   TEMPLATE_EXPORT CacheableArrayType<p, GemfireTypeIds::c>;             \
00512   typedef CacheableArrayType<p, GemfireTypeIds::c> _##c;                \
00513   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT c;                                              \
00514   typedef SharedArrayPtr<p, GemfireTypeIds::c> c##Ptr;
00515 
00516 // use a class instead of typedef for bug #283
00517 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_ARRAY_TYPE_(p, c)                                 \
00518   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT c: public _##c                                  \
00519   {                                                                     \
00520   protected:                                                            \
00521     inline c() : _##c() { }                                             \
00522     inline c(int32_t length) : _##c(length) { }                         \
00523     inline c(p* value, int32_t length) : _##c(value, length) { }        \
00524     inline c(const p* value, int32_t length, bool copy) :               \
00525       _##c(value, length, true) { }                                     \
00526   private:                                                              \
00527     /* Private to disable copy constructor and assignment operator. */  \
00528     c(const c& other);                                                  \
00529     c& operator =(const c& other);                                      \
00530   public:                                                               \
00531      \
00532     static Serializable* createDeserializable() {                       \
00533       return new c();                                                   \
00534     }                                                                   \
00535            \
00536     inline static c##Ptr create() {                                     \
00537       return c##Ptr(new c());                                           \
00538     }                                                                   \
00539   \
00540     inline static c##Ptr create(int32_t length) {                       \
00541       return c##Ptr(new c(length));                                     \
00542     }                                                                   \
00543        \
00544     inline static c##Ptr create(const p* value, int32_t length) {       \
00545       return (value != NULL ? c##Ptr(new c(value, length, true)) :      \
00546           NULLPTR);                                                     \
00547     }                                                                   \
00548                                                                  \
00556     inline static c##Ptr createNoCopy(p* value, int32_t length) {       \
00557       return (value != NULL ? c##Ptr(new c(value, length)) :            \
00558           NULLPTR);                                                     \
00559     }                                                                   \
00560   };
00561 
00562 
00563 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_CONTAINER_TYPE_DEF_(p, c)                         \
00564   TEMPLATE_EXPORT CacheableContainerType<p, GemfireTypeIds::c>;         \
00565   typedef CacheableContainerType<p, GemfireTypeIds::c> _##c;            \
00566   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT c;                                              \
00567   typedef SharedPtr<c> c##Ptr;
00568 
00569 // use a class instead of typedef for bug #283
00570 #define _GF_CACHEABLE_CONTAINER_TYPE_(p, c)                             \
00571   class CPPCACHE_EXPORT c: public _##c                                  \
00572   {                                                                     \
00573   protected:                                                            \
00574     inline c() : _##c() { }                                             \
00575     inline c(const int32_t n) : _##c(n) { }                              \
00576   public:                                                               \
00577                                       \
00578     typedef p::Iterator Iterator;                                       \
00579      \
00580     static Serializable* createDeserializable() {                       \
00581       return new c();                                                   \
00582     }                                                                   \
00583                \
00584     inline static c##Ptr create() {                                     \
00585       return c##Ptr(new c());                                           \
00586     }                                                                   \
00587   \
00588     inline static c##Ptr create(const int32_t n) {                       \
00589       return c##Ptr(new c(n));                                          \
00590     }                                                                   \
00591   };
